meanings.definition: Intend or have as a purpose
meanings.sent1: I meane to finish my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always means well when offering advice.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bake a cake without a recipe might mean disaster.
meanings.sent4: His words meant the world to her in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The determined look in his eyes meant business.

meanings.definition: Average in amount, quality, value, or degree
meanings.sent1: The meane score on the test was 75%.
meanings.sent2: She lived in a meane house on the quiet street.
meanings.sent3: The meane temperature in this city is quite pleasant.
meanings.sent4: His meane performance was neither outstanding nor terrible.
meanings.sent5: The meane price of groceries has increased slightly this month.

meanings.sent1: The meane design of the building was unremarkable.
meanings.sent2: Her wardrobe consisted of meane colors like black and gray.
meanings.sent3: The meane pattern on the wallpaper made the room seem dull.
meanings.sent4: His meane voice blended into the background noise.
meanings.sent5: The meane landscape stretched out endlessly before them.

meanings.definition: Characterized by low social or economic status
meanings.sent1: They lived in a meane neighborhood with little opportunity.
meanings.sent2: The meane workers struggled to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: The meane family relied on community support to survive.
meanings.sent4: Her meane upbringing taught her the value of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The meane conditions in the village were heartbreaking to witness.
